article_text:
Wisconsin Republicans made their primary a referendum on Donald Trump, which he lost. Now the beneficiary of this anti-Trump surge, Ted Cruz, must reassemble the same coalition in the remaining states, persuade a reluctant GOP to rally behind him, and then expand his general-election appeal. Other than that, the White House is his.

In other words, Mr. Cruz’s chance to become President hinges on the so-called Republican...

twitter.description: Ted Cruz now needs the same Republicans he calls ‘the surrender caucus.’ Good luck, the Wall Street Journal writes in an editorial.
twitter.title: The Cruz Conundrum

Other than that, the White House is his.
